subject: AI & Agents
title: Quantum AI: Computing's Next Leap
description: A fast breakdown of Quantum AI: Computing's Next Leap for builders.

hook.text: Quantum computers process information in ways classical computers never can. What happens when AI meets quantum?

buildup.text: Quantum computing exploits superposition and entanglement to solve certain problems exponentially faster.

discovery.text: Quantum machine learning could optimize models, search solution spaces, and simulate molecules far faster.

twist.text: Current quantum computers are noisy and tiny. Practical quantum AI is likely decades away.

climax.text: Google, IBM, and startups are racing to build quantum hardware capable of real AI workloads.

punchline.text: Classical AI changed the world. Quantum AI might change the universe.

quiz.question: Why is practical quantum AI still far away?
options: Current quantum computers are noisy and too small for real workloads
Quantum computing has been fully solved
AI doesn't benefit from quantum computing
